2. Terms Generally: Except as provided in subsection B3 of this section, each appointment of a member shall be for a term of one
year or until that member's replacement has been appointed.
3. Chairperson: The village president, with the advice and consent of the board of trustees, shall appoint one trustee as chairperson
and one trustee as vice chairperson. The chairperson, or the vice chairperson in the absence of the chairperson, shall preside at
all meetings and shall fulfill the customary functions of the position of chairperson. The chairperson and vice chairperson shall
serve in that position until the expiration of their term or until the village president has made a new appointment to those
positions, whichever is sooner.
C. Duties And Responsibilities: It shall be the responsibility of the tree board to study, investigate, develop, update and administer a
comprehensive plan for the care, preservation, pruning, planting, replanting, removal or disposition of trees and shrubs in parks,
along streets, and in other public areas. The tree board, when requested by the village board of trustees shall consider, investigate,
make finding, report and recommend upon any special matter coming within the scope of its work. The decision of the tree board is
considered final and binding. The tree board may assign specific duties and delegate responsibility and authority for day to day
operation and activities to the village tree crew through the director of public services. (Ord. O2015-12, 4-21-2015)
7-2-11: GENERAL PENALTY:
Unless a more specific fine or permit provision from this chapter applies, any person convicted of a violation of any provision of this
chapter shall be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each offense. Each day any violation of any
provision of this chapter shall occur or continue shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord. O2016-16, 3-17-2016)
Chapter 3
PUBLIC PARKS
7-3-1: HOURS OF OPERATION:
Public parks within the village shall be open for use between the hours of five o'clock (5:00) A.M. and ten o'clock (10:00) P.M., with the
exception of the paddle tennis courts and paddle tennis hut located at Katherine Legge Memorial park which shall be open for use until
ten thirty o'clock (10:30) P.M. from October 1 through April 30. The hours of operation of public parks for programs or events
sponsored or approved by the village, or for which a village permit has been issued, may be extended for any such program or event
for a period of sixty (60) minutes following the conclusion of such program or event. Signs stating park hours shall be posted
prominently in each park. (Ord. O2008-20, 5-6-2008)
7-3-2: AUTHORIZATION OF PARK USAGE:
The village manager may authorize usage of all village of Hinsdale public parks for nonprofit recreational purposes for a period not to
exceed twenty four (24) hours. (Ord. O2008-20, 5-6-2008)
7-3-3: GOLF AND ARCHERY PROHIBITED:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 301/605
No person shall play or practice golf or archery in any village park unless such play or practice is under the direct supervision of the
director of parks and recreation. (Ord. O2008-20, 5-6-2008)
7-3-4: FIRES PROHIBITED:
Except in a structure or stove designed for cooking or warming purposes no person shall light or build a fire in any village park unless
such fire is lit or built under the direct supervision of the director of parks and recreation. (Ord. O2008-20, 5-6-2008)
7-3-5: BANNER APPROVALS:
The village manager may authorize the approval of banner requests following the requirements listed in the village of Hinsdale banner
placement policy. (Ord. O2007-48, 7-17-2007)
7-3-6: PENALTY:
Any person convicted of a violation of any provision of this chapter shall be punished by a fine of not less than ten dollars ($10.00) nor
more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each offense; provided, however, that if service of summons is made by certified mail
pursuant to 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/1-2-9.1, then the maximum fine shall not exceed two hundred dollars ($200.00) for each
offense. Each day any violation of any provision of this chapter shall occur or continue shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord.
O2008-20, 5-6-2008)
Chapter 4
WATERWORKS AND SEWERAGE SYSTEM
ARTICLE A. COMBINED SYSTEM
7-4A-1: COMBINATION OF SYSTEMS:
It is hereby found, determined and declared necessary for the best interests of the village that the existing waterworks system of the
village and the existing sanitary sewerage system of the village be combined into a single utility to be known and designated as the
combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village, pursuant to 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/11-39-1 et seq. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4A-2: PROPERTIES OF SYSTEM:
All property, real, personal and mixed, comprising the now existing waterworks system and sanitary sewerage system of the village is
hereby found, determined and declared to constitute the properties of the combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village.
(Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4A-3: OPERATION OF SYSTEM:
From and after the effective date hereof said waterworks system and said sanitary sewerage system shall be owned and operated by
the village as a combined utility, known as the combined waterworks and sewerage system of the village, and all improvements and
extensions to said waterworks and sewerage system, either or both, shall be considered as improvements and extensions to said
combined utility; and all the properties, assets, obligations and liabilities, of all kinds, of said waterworks system and of said sanitary
sewerage system, existing, outstanding and accruing or to accrue, shall be held, used and acknowledged as the properties, assets,
obligations and liabilities of said combined utility. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4A-4: DISPOSITION OF REVENUES:
All revenues derived from the combined waterworks and sewerage system shall be held by the village treasurer separate and apart
from all other funds of the village and shall be deposited in the waterworks and sewerage fund promptly upon receipt of same. Said
funds shall be administered and disbursed in accordance with a separate ordinance. In the event of any conflict between the
provisions of said ordinance and this chapter, said ordinance shall control. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 302/605
ARTICLE B. WATER AND SEWER RATES
7-4B-1: SEWER RATES:
A. Authorization: Pursuant to division 139 or article 11 of the Illinois municipal code, the following separate sewer rates are hereby
established:
The sewer service charge is hereby established at an amount equivalent to fifteen percent (15%) of the water bill of each customer.
(Ord., 12-7-1982)
B. Applicability Of Charge: Customers subject to this charge shall include all users of water supplied by the combination waterworks
and sewerage system of the village, except customers whose sewers are connected directly to sewers owned, operated and
maintained by the Hinsdale sanitary district. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4B-2: WATER RATES:
A. Water Sold: The following rates shall be paid for water service for meters read on or about June 1, 1991, and thereafter:
WATER RATES
Bimonthly minimum charges for bimonthly usage in excess of 300 cubic feet for each 1,000 cubic feet:
$27.52 (net)
29.01 (gross)
Bimonthly charges rates:
$82.51 (net)
86.83 (gross)
1. Minimum Charges: The minimum charges include only the first three hundred (300) cubic feet per month.
2. Gross Rate: Gross rate applies after the due date stated on the water bill, which is approximately thirty (30) days after the date of
mailing.
3. Utility Tax: The charges above include the five percent (5%) village utility tax.
4. Water Customers Not Located Within The Village: Water customers not located within the corporate limits of the village of
Hinsdale shall be subject to a nonresident surcharge of twenty five percent (25%) upon all water use charges.
5. Large Water Customers: A water customer whose aggregate annual water usage exceeds two million (2,000,000) cubic feet for
all accounts in said customer's name shall be subject to a large user surcharge of fifty percent (50%). (Ord. O2015-03, 2-3-2015)
B. Special Rates For Air Conditioning And Refrigeration Systems: In addition to the rates charged for water under the provisions of this
chapter, all premises which have installed an air conditioning or refrigeration system as defined under article H of this chapter
without approved water conservation devices shall be charged an additional water rate per billing cycle equal to the minimum
bimonthly water rate set forth in subsection A of this section. (Ord. O2003-10, 4-15-2003)
7-4B-3: COLLECTION OF WATER CHARGES:
Charges for water shall commence on the date when the water is turned on in accordance with the written application for water service
and shall continue until notice is received by the village to discontinue water service, and a final meter reading is taken.
In the event of a change in ownership of premises receiving water service or a change in the tenancy of the premises where the new
tenant is to be charged for water service, the new owner or tenant shall be obligated to ascertain from the village the water and sewer
charges due to the village prior to executing a lease or closing a sale. Any amounts not paid by the prior tenant or owner prior to the
execution of the lease or prior to the closing of the sale shall become the obligation of the new tenant or owner and the village shall not
be obligated to sell water to the premises until the prior charges are paid.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 303/605
All water furnished shall be charged and paid for as measured and registered by meters, and the amount so charged shall be billed
and become due and payable in bimonthly installments. If a due date falls on a Sunday or on a legal holiday on which the village office
is closed, then the due date shall be extended to the next following business day on which the village office is open. Any applicable
discount will be allowed on a remittance made by mail if said remittance bears a postmark dated prior to twelve o'clock (12:00)
midnight of the due date.
If more than one unit in a multiple-family building is connected to a single meter, then the total water usage for the combined units shall
be divided by the number of units and the charge for water will be made on a per unit basis on the assumption that each unit
consumed its proportionate share of the water. The minimum charge per unit shall be based on the minimum charge applicable to a
five-eighths inch (5/8") meter size. (Ord. O2003-10, 4-15-2003)
7-4B-4: LIEN FOR DELINQUENT CHARGES1:
Whenever a bill for water or sewer service remains unpaid for two (2) months after it has been rendered, or in the event the village
receives notice from any source that premises are about to be sold, all charges for water shall be deemed delinquent as to said
premises. The village clerk shall thereupon file with the recorder of deeds of the county in which the property is located a lien claim in
accordance with 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/11-139-8. Said lien shall be foreclosed in the manner provided in said statute. (Ord., 9-
20-1984)
7-4B-5: DISCONTINUATION OF WATER SERVICE; CHARGES:
A. Discontinuation Of Service: If payment of any water bill is not received by the village within fifteen (15) days after the due date
specified on such bill, or if a water service customer has failed to comply with any provision of this code pertaining to the provision
of water service, then the director of finance shall mail notice to the delinquent customer that water service to such customer shall
be discontinued unless said payment is made or compliance with this code is completed within ten (10) days after the date of
mailing said notice. Said notice shall provide that such customer request a meeting at which such customer may present evidence
regarding whether water service should be discontinued. Such meeting if requested, must be held prior to the scheduled water
shutoff date. If no such meeting is requested or if no good cause is established at such meeting why water service should not be
shut off, then the village shall discontinue water service to the delinquent customer immediately and until said payment of the
charges established in subsection B of this section are paid or compliance with this code is completed. (Ord. O2003-10, 4-15-2003)
B. Charges For Renewal Of Service: The following charges for renewal of water service shall be due and payable immediately after
the decision of the director of finance that the water service shall be discontinued, regardless of whether the water service actually
was shut off by the village:
1. Renewal requests from seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. to three thirty o'clock (3:30) P.M.: Fifty dollars ($50.00); and
2. Renewal requests between three thirty o'clock (3:30) P.M. and seven o'clock (7:00) A.M.: One hundred dollars ($100.00). (Ord.
O2008-26, 6-3-2008)
7-4B-6: METER TESTING IN THE CASE OF CONTESTED BILLS:
In cases of a contested bill, the customer may request that the meter be tested for accuracy. No charge will be made for the test if it is
found that the meter needs repair through normal use. If the meter is found to be accurate within two percent (2%), the customer shall
be required to reimburse the village for the cost of the test. (Ord. O2014-43, 12-16-2014)
ARTICLE C. SEWERS; GENERAL PROVISIONS
7-4C-1: MANUAL OF PROCEDURES FOR ISSUANCE OF SEWER PERMITS ADOPTED:
The manual of procedures for the issuance of sewer permits of the metropolitan sanitary district of Chicago is hereby adopted. Three
(3) copies of this manual are on file in the office of the village clerk. (Ord., 6-29-1971)
7-4C-2: PERMIT REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to make any connections with any village sewer without having first obtained a permit therefor. Applications for such
permits shall be made to the village clerk and shall be accompanied by a statement as to the purpose of such connection, the
premises to be served and the specification of such pipe to be connected and the drain from house to sewer pipe. Such applications
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 304/605
shall be referred to the plumbing inspector; and no such permit shall be issued unless he shall have found that the ordinances of the
village would be complied with by making of such connections. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-3: INSTALLATION, REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE COSTS:
The owner of any premises in the village served by a connection with the village sewer system shall install, maintain, repair and when
necessary replace the house sewer service line from its connection with the village sewer system to the building it serves, at his
expense. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-4: STREET OPENINGS1:
The provisions of chapter 1, article B of this title relating to excavations in streets shall be complied with in making excavations in
streets or other public places for sewer connections. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-5: GARAGE DRAINAGE:
Floor drains in garages shall be connected with the storm sewer system; such drains shall have intercepting mud or grease traps
adequate to prevent the flow of mud or greases into the sewer system. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-6: PROHIBITED SUBSTANCES; INJURY:
It shall be unlawful for any person to permit any gasoline, benzine or other volatile liquid to flow into any public sewer in the village; or
to permit any material which might injure any part of the sanitary sewer system to flow into it. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-7: RAINWATER DRAINS:
It shall be unlawful to construct or permit the construction of any storm water drain which discharges water onto any sidewalk in the
village, and it shall be unlawful to construct or permit the maintenance of any such drain which discharges into any public street or
alley at a height greater than eighteen inches (18") above the ground or pavement. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-8: CROSS-CONNECTIONS; SEPARATION OF STORM INFLOWS:
A. It shall be unlawful to permit any sanitary sewage to flow into any storm sewer or any storm sewer to flow into any sanitary sewer.
B. Inflow sources of storm water to the combined sanitary and storm sewer system shall be connected to a storm sewer within a
reasonable amount of time if a storm sewer becomes available. (Ord. O2001-14, 3-6-2001)
7-4C-9: PROTECTION OF WELLS:
It shall be unlawful to install any public or private sanitary sewer, or combined sanitary and storm sewer or drain of any character, in
the village within the boundaries of a circle which is one hundred feet (100') in diameter and where the center of said one hundred foot
(100') circle is identical with the center of any water well furnishing water for the municipal water supply of the village, except that any
such sanitary sewer or drain may be installed within the boundaries of said circle if the portion within the circle is constructed of castiron
pipe with watertight joints tested to one hundred (100) pounds per square inch pressure without leakage except that in no event
shall any sewer or drain be installed closer than ten feet (10') to any municipal water well, regardless of type of construction. Any such
sewer or drain line installed within the boundaries of said circle shall be inspected and approved both as to installation methods and
pressure test by the plumbing inspector before the same can be covered and placed in service. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4C-10: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be fined not less than five dollars ($5.00) nor more than five hundred dollars
($500.00) for each offense; and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or
continues. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 305/605
ARTICLE D. SEWER SERVICE CONNECTIONS OUTSIDE VILLAGE LIMITS
7-4D-1: CONNECTIONS AND EXTENSIONS OUTSIDE VILLAGE LIMITS:
A. Connections: Permission is hereby granted to any property outside the Village limits to connect to and be serviced by the Hinsdale
sanitary sewer system, provided said property is located within either the Hinsdale sanitary district or the sanitary district of
Metropolitan Sanitary District of Greater Chicago, and provided further, that the owner of said property complies with all the
requirements and regulations of this Chapter.
B. Extensions: Upon presentation of a petition requesting same, the Board of Trustees of the Village may, in their discretion, grant
permission for the extension of any sanitary sewer main of the Village beyond the corporate limits of the Village for the purpose of
serving property outside the Village limits but located within either the Hinsdale sanitary district or the Metropolitan Sanitary District
of Greater Chicago. In the event any such extension or portion thereof is located in a street that forms a boundary of the Village,
the property inside the Village limits abutting or having frontage on said boundary street shall have the right to connect to said
sewer extension under the same conditions as other property inside the Village can connect to any Village sewer. Any such sewer
extension to serve outside property shall be installed at no expense to the Village and shall be installed only after adequate
easements covering the installation are secured, and in compliance with all provisions of this Chapter before connection to the
Village sewer system shall be permitted.
7-4D-2: CONDITIONS OF CONNECTION OR EXTENSION:
A. Sewer Permits Required: No property outside the Village limits shall be permitted to connect to and be serviced by the Hinsdale
sanitary sewer system without first obtaining a permit therefor and after paying the required fee.
B. Approval by the Board of Trustees: No permit shall be issued for such connection of any property outside the Village and serviced
by the Village sanitary sewer system until application therefor is first approved by the Village President and Board of Trustees.
C. Permit Fees: No permit shall be issued for such connection of any outside property to a Village sewer until an inspection fee of ten
dollars ($10.00) shall have been paid to the Village Treasurer. Permit requirements shall not apply to outside property already
connected to the sewer system of the Village.
7-4D-3: VILLAGE WATER SERVICES REQUIRED:
No property located outside the corporate limits of the Village shall be permitted to connect to any Village sewer until and after the
premises to be served by said sewer is already served by a connection to the Village water supply system. No applications for an
outside sewer connection or petition for a sewer main extension shall be considered by the Village President and Board of Trustees
unless accompanied by suitable evidence that the property will be served by Village water prior to connection with the sewer system.
Any water mains or services installed to serve property outside the Village corporate limits shall comply with the provisions relating to
water in this Code.1
7-4D-4: OUTSIDE SEWERS PROPERTY OF VILLAGE:
Any sewer main extension approved and installed in compliance herewith to serve property outside the Village limits shall become the
property of the Village immediately upon installation and connection to the Village sewer and all easements covering said main shall be
assigned to the Village.
7-4D-5: MAINTENANCE OF OUTSIDE SEWERS:
The ordinary maintenance of any outside sewer installed under the provisions herein shall be assumed by the village in the same
general manner as maintenance of sewers inside the village. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4D-6: LATERAL CONNECTIONS:
Sewer lateral connections from the main sewer to the wall of the building served shall comply in all respects to the requirements of the
village plumbing code2 and shall be installed by a licensed plumber. Village plumbing code requirements or fees for plumbing work
inside a building shall not apply to property outside the village limits. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 306/605
7-4D-7: REQUIREMENTS FOR OUTSIDE MAIN EXTENSION:
No extension for the sewer mains by the village to serve property outside the village limits shall be installed until there is first submitted
to the village, detailed plans and profiles of the proposed work. A surety bond in an amount equal to the full cost of the extension as
estimated by the village, in favor of the village, guaranteeing that the work shall be performed in accordance with the plans and
specifications shall be furnished before said work is started. Plans, profiles and specifications shall require the written approval of the
village manager before any such extension to the village sewer system is installed. If, in the opinion of the village manager, a field
inspector appointed by the village is required to supervise the installation of any such sewer extension, a cash deposit shall be made
prior to starting the work in an amount specified by the village manager to pay the wages of such inspector during the period of such
installation. Any portion of said deposit in excess of the sum used to pay the wages of said inspector shall be refunded to the
depositor. The village may require that plans and specifications be prepared by and construction supervised by a licensed engineer.
(Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4D-8: STORM WATER PROHIBITED:
The connection of roof downspouts, surface catch basins or other methods of introducing surface or storm water into any such outside
sanitary sewer main is hereby prohibited. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
ARTICLE E. WATER; GENERAL PROVISIONS
7-4E-1: SUPERVISION:
The system of water mains and pipes, softening plant, pumping station, grounds, buildings and appurtenances thereto shall be under
the administrative control of the director of public services subject to the recommendations to the director of public services by the
utilities commission as approved by the village president and board of trustees and to the direction and authority of the village
president and board of trustees. (Ord., 8-2-1966)
7-4E-2: PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall in any way use or take water for private use from the village water system or from any pipes or systems connected
therewith whether located inside or outside the village limits, unless such consumer has first applied to the village for service and has
received a permit from the director of public services.
Before any excavation or other construction work is started for the purpose of supplying water to any premises, application shall be
made and a permit issued by the director of public services, allowing the installation of the water service. Said permit shall only be
issued by the director after the payment of all fees required for water services. (Ord., 2-4-1975)
7-4E-3: USE OF FIRE HYDRANTS:
No person, except a regularly authorized agent of the village shall cause water to flow from any public or private fire hydrant, except
that a person other than such an agent of the village may operate and use water from a fire hydrant only after a written permit has
been issued by the director of public services permitting such use and only after suitable arrangements, approved by the director, for
payment for such water used have been made. (Ord., 8-1-1972)
7-4E-4: INJURY TO WATER UTILITY:
No person, other than a regularly authorized agent of the village in line of duty shall interfere in any manner with any public or private
fire hydrant, water main, main line valve or box or commit any act tending to obstruct the use thereof without first obtaining a permit
from the director of public services. No person shall wilfully or carelessly break, injure, mar, deface, interfere with or disturb the walls,
fixtures, buildings, machinery, apparatus, fencing, reservoirs, storage tanks or any of the appurtenances of the water system. (Ord., 8-
1-1972)
7-4E-5: EXCAVATION NEAR WATER MAINS:
Any person making an excavation in the vicinity of existing mains shall be fully responsible for any damage or leakage to or from said
water mains and shall repair immediately such damage or leakage to the satisfaction of the director of public services and upon failure
to do so shall be subject to the penalties provided herein. (Ord., 8-1-1972)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=967 307/605
7-4E-6: LAWN SPRINKLING RESTRICTIONS; PENALTIES:
A. General Lawn Sprinkling Restriction: Except as provided in subsections B and C of this section, lawn sprinkling shall be permitted
from May 15 through September 15 only between the hours of six o'clock (6:00) A.M. and ten o'clock (10:00) A.M. and the hours of
six o'clock (6:00) P.M. and ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. and only on the following days:
1. Even numbered street addresses: Even numbered calendar days.
2. Odd numbered street addresses: Odd numbered calendar days.
3. No sprinkling shall be permitted on May 31, July 31, and August 31.
B. New Grass Seed Or Sod: Notwithstanding the restrictions stated in subsection A of this section, the village manager, on the written
request of a property owner or her or his agent, may issue a temporary permit allowing sprinkling of a lawn with new grass seed or
sod. The temporary permit shall be issued only on a finding by the village manager that sprinkling is necessary to protect the new
seed or sod from damage due to inadequate water. A temporary permit may be issued for a time period not exceeding thirty (30)
days. The temporary permit must be prominently displayed on the affected property in a location visible from an adjacent street.
The village manager may impose conditions and limitations on a temporary permit as the village manager deems necessary or
appropriate. No fee shall be charged for a temporary permit.
C. Additional Sprinkling And Water Use Restrictions: In addition to the restrictions stated in subsection A of this section, the village
manager may impose any one or more of the following additional restrictions on sprinkling if the village manager determines that
such restrictions are necessary or appropriate to protect the village's water supply system:
1. A further reduction of allowable lawn sprinkling hours; or
2. Limitations on the watering of shrubs, trees, ornamental plants, gardens, or other vegetation; or
3. A complete ban on all outside water usage, including, without limitation, lawn sprinkling and car washing except by commercial
car washing businesses.
D. Violations; Penalties: It shall be unlawful to violate any restriction imposed by, or pursuant to, this section. Each day on which a
violation occurs shall be deemed a separate violation of this section. Each violation shall be punishable by a fine up to two hundred
dollars ($200.00), according to the following schedule:
1. First violation in any calendar year: Warning citation, no fine.
2. Second and subsequent violations in any calendar year:
Description

First violation in 30 day period $ 25.00 $ 35.00 $ 50.00
Second violation in 30 day period 50.00 70.00 100.00
Third and additional violation(s) in 30 day period 100.00 140.00 200.00
The time periods set forth in this table run beginning on the day after the date of issuance of the citation. If payment is not made within
thirty (30) days after the date of issuance of the citation, then a court appearance shall be required. (Ord. O2005-53, 11-15-2005)
7-4E-7: FLUORIDE:
A. Findings: Based upon studies of the special committee of the village board appointed to study water, fluoride and based on public
hearings, the village president and board of trustees hereby find that it is in the interests of public health that steps for the
introduction of fluoride in a concentration adequate for safety be taken.
B. Fluoride To Be Added: Fluoride shall be added to the village water supply in quantities sufficient to maintain in the entire village an
optimum fluoride level of one (1.0) part per million parts of water. Said fluoride shall be added in accordance with regulations
prescribed by the Illinois department of health and the department of public services of the village.
C. Effective Date: This section shall be in full force and effect upon its passage and approval September 7, 1965, as provided by law.
(Ord., 8-2-1966)
